amendment.description: Amendment sought to increase funding for Special Education grants by $291 million and reduce by the same amount funds appropriated for the National Institutes of Health.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 22 in the Congressional Record of July 10, 1996, to increase funds appropriated in the bill for the Special Education grants to states by $291 million and to reduce funds appropriated for the National Institutes of Health comensurately.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Goodling amendment (A010) Failed by voice vote.
